text: In particular, the aerial manipulator can successfully perform navigation and interaction phases, while keeping motion within prescribed bounds and avoiding collisions with external obstacles.
We then demonstrate performance on a task in which a slipping object must be caught.

Here, we demonstrate our method with up to 900 hybrid dynamic obstacles and show that it outperforms the traditional Gaussian APF method by up to 60% in the holonomic case and up to 20% in the unicycle case.
These robots may thus have the capacities of flight, contact locomotion, and manipulation, and benefit from technologies and methods developed for Whole-Body Control  and Aerial Manipulation.
